user_error_text: Windows update failed — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
symptoms: Updates fail repeatedly with generic error messages or codes.
cause: Corrupted update cache, missing files, or service failure.
step_1: Run the Windows Update Troubleshooter from Settings → System → Troubleshoot.
step_2: Stop update services and clear cache: stop wuauserv and delete SoftwareDistribution folder.
step_3: Run SFC scan: sfc /scannow to repair system files.
step_4: Run DISM: DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth to fix Windows image.
step_5: Manually install updates using Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.
log_snippet: DISM: Component store corruption — Windows update failed

user_error_text: Update stuck at 100% — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
cause: Corrupted installer or OS component conflict.
step_1: Wait at least 20 minutes—some updates take extra time.
step_2: Restart the computer and retry the update.
step_3: Run SFC and DISM to repair damaged components.
step_4: Disconnect external devices and try again.
step_5: Install update manually via Microsoft Update Catalog.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.
log_snippet: SFC: Corrupt system files found — Update stuck at 100%

user_error_text: Feature update cannot install — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
cause: Driver issues, insufficient space, or incompatible software.
step_1: Free up at least 20GB of disk space.
step_2: Update all drivers (GPU, chipset, network).
step_3: Uninstall incompatible antivirus or third-party firewall.
step_4: Run Windows Update Assistant to install feature update.
step_5: Use Media Creation Tool to upgrade manually.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.
log_snippet: SFC: Corrupt system files found — Feature update cannot install

user_error_text: Error 0x80070002 — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
symptoms: Windows update fails with file not found error.
cause: Missing update files or corrupted update cache.
step_1: Stop Windows Update services.
step_2: Delete SoftwareDistribution and CatRoot2 folders.
step_3: Restart services and retry updates.
step_4: Run SFC and DISM repair commands.
step_5: Install update manually if issue persists.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.
log_snippet: DISM: Component store corruption — Error 0x80070002

user_error_text: Error 0x8024a105 — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
cause: Connectivity issue or Windows Update service hang.
step_1: Restart PC and router.
step_2: Disable metered connection in Network settings.
step_3: Reset Windows Update components.
step_4: Run Windows Update Troubleshooter.
step_5: Install update manually.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.

user_error_text: SFC scan cannot repair files — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
symptoms: sfc /scannow reports files it cannot fix.
cause: Component Store corruption.
step_1: Run DISM /RestoreHealth to repair image.
step_2: Run SFC again after DISM finishes.
step_3: Check CBS.log for specific corrupted system files.
step_4: Perform an in-place repair upgrade using Media Creation Tool.
step_5: Backup files and reset Windows if repair upgrade fails.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.

user_error_text: DISM restore health failure — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
cause: Missing source files or damaged component store.
step_1: Retry DISM with: DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth.
step_2: Provide repair source using Windows ISO: DISM /RestoreHealth /Source:WIM:D:\sources\install.wim:1.
step_3: Run SFC afterward.
step_4: Perform a repair upgrade using Media Creation Tool.
step_5: Reset Windows if all repairs fail.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.

user_error_text: We couldn’t complete the updates — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
cause: Update installation failure or missing files.
step_1: Restart PC and attempt the update again.
step_2: Clear Windows Update cache.
step_3: Run DISM and SFC repairs.
step_4: Update drivers and uninstall conflicting software.
step_5: Install update manually or use Update Assistant.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.

user_error_text: Rollback loop after update — Windows cannot finish updates and shows an error message.
symptoms: PC reverts changes every time after restart.
cause: Failed feature update or incompatible driver.
step_1: Boot into Safe Mode and uninstall recently installed updates.
step_2: Update all drivers and remove antivirus/firewall apps.
step_3: Run SFC and DISM to repair core files.
step_4: Attempt update via Update Assistant/Media Creation Tool.
step_5: Backup files and perform repair install if loop continues.
verification: Updates install successfully and Windows version matches expected build.
